contentrichtext.text: '''Baron Colyton''', of Farway in the County of Devon and Taunton in the County of Somerset, is a title in the [[Peerage of the United Kingdom]]. It was created in 1956 for the diplomat and [[Conservative Party (UK)|Conservative]] politician [[Henry Hopkinson, 1st Baron Colyton|Henry Hopkinson]]. He notably served as [[Minister of State for the Colonies]] from 1952 to 1955. {{As of|2010}}, the title is held by his grandson, the second Baron, who succeeded in 1996. == Barons Colyton (1956) == * [[Henry Hopkinson, 1st Baron Colyton|Henry Lennox D'Aubigne Hopkinson, 1st Baron Colyton]] (1902â€“1996) * Alisdair John Munro Hopkinson, 2nd Baron Colyton (b. 1958) The [[heir apparent]] is the present holder's son Hon. James Patrick Munro Hopkinson (b. 1983) ==Notes== {{unreferenced|date=February 2013}} {{reflist}} == References == * Kidd, Charles, Williamson, David (editors). ''Debrett's Peerage and Baronetage'' (1990 edition). New York: St Martin's Press, 1990, {{Page needed |date=February 2013}} * {{Rayment|date=February 2012}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Colyton}} [[Category:Baronies in the Peerage of the United Kingdom]]
